intro: Ficinia pallens var. lithosperma, commonly known as the stonefruit ficinia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories or rocky crevices. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to nutrient-poor soils and its role in local ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
